title: 109_s690
content: The Act may be cited as the "American Indian Reservation Transportation Improvement Program Act" and pertains to Indian Reservation Roads. The "American Indian Reservation Transportation Improvement Program Act" authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 1998 to 2009, totaling $225 million to $480 million annually. The "American Indian Reservation Transportation Improvement Program Act" authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 1998 to 2009, totaling $225 million to $480 million annually. Additional authorization of contract authority for states with Indian reservations is amended to allocate specific amounts for fiscal years 2004 to 2009. Funding for Indian Reservation Road Bridges is also addressed in the amendment. The "American Indian Reservation Transportation Improvement Program Act" authorizes appropriations from the Highway Trust Fund of $15,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2004 through 2009 for various transportation projects. These funds are to be used for planning, design, engineering, preconstruction, construction, and inspection of projects to replace infrastructure. The funds are available for obligation in the same manner as apportioned funds under chapter 1 and cannot be used for administrative costs. SEC. 3. INDIAN RESERVATION RURAL TRANSIT PROGRAM. The Indian Reservation Rural Transit Program is defined in section 5311 of title 49, United States Code, with specific definitions for 'Indian tribe' and 'reservation'. The Secretary of Transportation, through the Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration, will establish a program to provide competitive grants to Indian tribes for rural transit programs on reservations. Cooperation between the Federal Highway Administration and the Federal Transit Administration will be maintained for administering tribal transit programs. The program funded by the Federal Highway Administration aims to explore transferring funds to the Federal Transit Administration for direct funding of tribal transit programs. It also involves establishing relationships with tribal technical assistance programs for proper administration of ongoing and future tribal transit programs using Federal funds. For the fiscal year, the Secretary will allocate $20,000,000 under section 5338 to carry out this subsection.
